text: This is somewhat tangential to this conversation, but I really like Retool. It's not no-code, but it's niche is building "data apps" where you're just shepherding around data from various sources with some combination of filters and maybe buttons. They let you write custom JavaScript snippets to transform and filter the data, but for the relatively simple stuff, it's really cool. Connects to Google sheets or SQL databases or even custom REST/GraphQL APIs.

text:
I think most no-code tools are in the uncanny valley. Not quite flexible enough to do what you want but so tempting because you don't have to do the "boring" stuff (setting up forms and hosting and everything). Retool is like... 98% just because it lets you write JS code for that "last mile" of customization.

(this is not an ad I just really like Retool)
